result.execSummary:
The defendant Latisha Patrice Lagrone was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Provide a DNA sample; pay surcharge. Pay all applicable court costs and surcharges within 1 year, by 09-06-16 or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered. Cash bail applied.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence; Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply, ONLY IF WORKING. Defendant to report in one week on 09-11-2015
**10/13/2015  defendant may be released to complete an anger management class and to particpate in a court ordered psychological evaluation.  May also be released for visitation with her children on Tuesdays and Thursdays from 4:00 p.m. to 6:00 p.m.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that her voting rights are suspended and she may not vote in any election until her  civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Latisha Patrice Lagrone

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defense counsel has filed a motion requesting additional release privileges.  State has no objection.
Received, signed and filed:
Decision and order granting request for additional release privileges.  
Copy given to Attorney Ertl in court.
cab
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Kremers, Br. 36, for review. jbs
Letter from defendant seeking additional release privileges and early release.
Letter from defendant about Huber being taken from her.

Per Order signed on 10/13/2015:  defendant may be released to complete an Anger management class and to participate in a Court ordered psychological evaluation. Defendant may also be released for visitation with her children on Tuesdays and Thursdays from 4 p.m. to 6 p.m.

Received, signed and filed:
Decision and Order Granting Request for Additional Release Privileges.
Copies forwarded to parties on today's date.
cab
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Kremers, Br. 36, for review. crt
From Atty. Ertl requesting Huber for childcare and treatment.

Defendant Latisha Patrice Lagrone in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  cab
Parties are in court for sentencing.
Statements as to sentencing by both counsel and the defendant.
As to count 1:
The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 15 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply, ONLY IF WORKING.  Defendant to report in in one week, on 09/11/2015.  
  Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges within 1 year, by 09/06/2016,  or if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered.
  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
Defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge.
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
cab

Defendant Latisha Patrice Lagrone in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for final pre-trial however, parties have reached a resolution.  Court ordered the jury trial date of 09/02/2015 vacated.

As to Count 1: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.   Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that her voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until her civil rights are restored.

As to Count 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in to the case for the purposes of sentencing.

Case adjourned to Branch 36.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Received & Filed, Justice Point VIOLATION Report: Missed Office Contact.
STATE SUBPEONA for JURY TRIAL PROCEEDINGS SEPTEMBER 02, 2015 8:30 AM.
Final pre-trial on August 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial on September 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Latisha Patrice Lagrone NOT in court, appearance waived with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Molly Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called at request of Branch 36. Case set for Final Pretrial on 8/11/2015. Judge Kremers is not in session on that day. Court VACATED the final pretrial date and rescheduled matter for Final Pretrial in branch 36. Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Latisha Patrice Lagrone in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
JUDGE KUHNMUENCH FOR JUDGE GRADY IN BRANCH 23
Discussion regarding no contact order, remains in effect. Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to a branch of the Circuit Court to be determined. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report.

15RM021993  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
04/25/2015
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with any of the defendant's minor children, including VML (DOB 8/16/02) unless as approved per Children's Court Orders, or if Childrens' Court is NOT involved, unless as approved and monitored by BMCW.

Defendant Latisha Patrice Lagrone in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Defendant Latisha Patrice Lagrone in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant plead not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 23.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: VML (dob: 8/16/00), unless as approved per Children's Court Orders, or if Children's Court is not involved, unless as approved and monitored by the Bureau of Milwaukee Child Welfare.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Latisha Patrice Lagrone in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Latisha Patrice Lagrone in custody.  
Karen Loebel  appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. 
On motion of the State to amend complaint, GRANTED by Court.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4).

Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
